posts.post_content:
Nabbed one at the prerelease, and good lord. The sheer POWER of this thing cannot be overstated. The ability to recur a chump blocker (like say, [Typhoid Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Typhoid Rats)) over and over is amazing already. Doing it with ETB creatures or anything with Undying? This thing isn't just a lich, it's the best "necromancer" creature card I've ever seen.  
  
Although he had a habit of getting murdered by my [Reaper of the Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of the Abyss) (I was a lucky boy this morning) over and over. That thing's ability isn't a "may" effect!
posts.html:
Nabbed one at the prerelease, and good lord. The sheer POWER of this thing cannot be overstated. The ability to recur a chump blocker (like say, Typhoid Rats) over and over is amazing already. Doing it with ETB creatures or anything with Undying? This thing isn't just a lich, it's the best "necromancer" creature card I've ever seen.

posts.post_content:
[Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) + [Havengul Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Havengul Lich) + [Priest of Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Urabrask) + [Perilous Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perilous Myr) = the end :>  
  
Hearless Summoning will kill Priest of Urabrask when you cast her but gives you three mana for 2 mana (by Havengul skill and 1 red mana cc of Priest of Urabrask) now you use this 3 mana to regen both Perilous Myr Priest of Urabrask. You'll have 0 floating mana in the process but you'll deal 2 and have 3 mana again to cast the combo :> infinity!
posts.html:
Heartless Summoning + Havengul Lich + Priest of Urabrask + Perilous Myr = the end :>

You'll have 0 floating mana in the process but you'll deal 2 and have 3 mana again to cast the combo :> infinity!

Posted By: Whysvert (3/1/2012 1:27:03 PM)

posts.post_content:
Absolutely amazing. It has a good body for its cost and excellent types.   
  
Oh yeah, I forgot his EPIC ability.   
  
Combined with a Necrotic ooze neither of them will stay in the graveyard for long, and that is only the simplest of possibilities. The combinations this guy will create, not to mention his card advantage generation, will make him a very fearsome threat and a must kill in any deck he appears in. I'm looking forward to running him in EDH, where the recasting aspect will truly shine.   
  
Overall, this guy is amazing, truly worthy of mythic status and something whose potential has barely been figured out yet. He will probably be a powerhouse.

Posted By: htgtmd (1/26/2012 3:33:37 PM)

posts.post_content: @Griffyn16 : To answer your question, no it's not instant speed. The key word in the card is cast. You can use the Lich's ability at any time. But whatever you target, you're still casting the creature and It still follows the rules of casting creatures. So you can't normally cast a creature at instant speed unless it has Flash.
posts.html:
@Griffyn16 : To answer your question, no it's not instant speed. The key word in the card is cast. You can use the Lich's ability at any time. But whatever you target, you're still casting the creature and It still follows the rules of casting creatures. So you can't normally cast a creature at instant speed unless it has Flash.

posts.post_content: @Findlesham: Yes, you can only cast a creature card in your graveyard -once- per time it is in your graveyard, if that wording makes sense. For example, your friend cannot cast five [Perilous Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perilous Myr)s off of one instance in his 'yard.
posts.html:
@Findlesham: Yes, you can only cast a creature card in your graveyard -once- per time it is in your graveyard, if that wording makes sense. For example, your friend cannot cast five Perilous Myrs off of one instance in his 'yard.

posts.post_content: To put in my two cents, since the argument seems to be about semantics anyway...it would let you cast creatures at instant speed, but only creatures with flash can be played at instant speed so you could flash in say...[Shimmer Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shimmer Myr) since you're probably playing [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) anyway. Could be interesting at least.

Posted By: Whysvert (3/1/2012 1:27:03 PM)

posts.post_content:
It will be quite good in a proper constructed or EDH deck but in limited its hosed down by 1 low costing card in this set  
  
[Grafdigger's Cage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafdigger's Cage) turns this creature into a mythic 5 mana 4/4 vanilla until you can get rid of it. And having to use his ability only on creatures you can cast (no stealing off colour stuff) and on your turn (ability does not state creature card has flash) means great planning must be done to get full use from this.  
  
On the other hand, I have seen it do wonderful things. Undying cards a lot harder to deal with even if the Lich cannot gain any abilities, as your undying cards can come back for just 1 extra colourless in addition to the cast cost  
  
Edit: For those who aren't sure about the ruling, have a look at [Ornate Kanzashi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornate Kanzashi), a card with a similar ability to 'cast' cards  
  
@garganeraboy  
  
No, Havengul Lich doesn't grant creature cards in graveyard flash . Using your wording, this would mean you can only play the Lich's abili... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
